misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm.
description: Use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm (AES).
recommendation: Use a stronger cryptographic algorithm, such as AES-GCM or ChaCha20.

misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation.
description: Selection of less-secure algorithm during negotiation.
recommendation: Use a more secure mode of operation, such as AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding or AES/GCM/PKCS5Padding.
